verses.verse: Therefore say, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: (Is. 11:11-16; Jer. 3:12, 18; 24:5; Ezek. 20:41, 42; 28:5) “I will gather you from the peoples, assemble you from the countries where you have been scattered, and I will give you the land of Israel.” ’
And they will go there, and they will take away all its (Ezek. 37:23) detestable things and all its abominations from there.

Then (Jer. 32:39; Ezek. 36:26; Zeph. 3:9) I will give them one heart, and I will put (Ps. 51:10; (Jer. 31:33); Ezek. 18:31) a new spirit within them, and take (Zech. 7:12; (Rom. 2:4, 5)) the stony heart out of their flesh, and give them a heart of flesh,
(Ps. 105:45) that they may walk in My statutes and keep My judgments and do them; (Jer. 24:7; Ezek. 14:11; 36:28; 37:27) and they shall be My people, and I will be their God.
But as for those whose hearts follow the desire for their detestable things and their abominations, (Ezek. 9:10) I will recompense their deeds on their own heads,” says the Lord GOD.
So the cherubim (Ezek. 1:19) lifted up their wings, with the wheels beside them, and the glory of the God of Israel was high above them.
And (Ezek. 8:4; 9:3) the glory of the LORD went up from the midst of the city and stood (Zech. 14:4) on the mountain, (Ezek. 43:2) which is on the east side of the city.
Then (Ezek. 8:3; 2 Cor. 12:2-4) the Spirit took me up and brought me in a vision by the Spirit of God into Chaldea, to those in captivity. And the vision that I had seen went up from me.
So I spoke to those in captivity of all the things the LORD had shown me.
Judah’s Captivity Portrayed Now the word of the LORD came to me, saying:

“Son of man, you dwell in the midst of (Is. 1:23; Ezek. 2:3, 6-8) a rebellious house, which (Is. 6:9; 42:20; Jer. 5:21; Matt. 13:13, 14; Mark 4:12; 8:18; (Luke 8:10; John 9:39-41; 12:40); Acts 28:26; Rom. 11:8) has eyes to see but does not see, and ears to hear but does not hear; (Ezek. 2:5) for they are a rebellious house.

“Therefore, son of man, prepare your belongings for captivity, and go into captivity by day in their sight. You shall go from your place into captivity to another place in their sight. It may be that they will consider, though they are a rebellious house.
By day you shall bring out your belongings in their sight, as though going into captivity; and at evening you shall go in their sight, like those who go into captivity.
Dig through the wall in their sight, and carry your belongings out through it.

In their sight you shall bear them on your shoulders and carry them out at twilight; you shall cover your face, so that you cannot see the ground, (Is. 8:18; Ezek. 4:3; 24:24) for I have made you a sign to the house of Israel.”

So I did as I was commanded. I brought out my belongings by day, as though going into captivity, and at evening I dug through the wall with my hand. I brought them out at twilight, and I bore them on my shoulder in their sight.
And in the morning the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
“Son of man, has not the house of Israel, (Ezek. 2:5) the rebellious house, said to you, (Ezek. 17:12; 24:19) ‘What are you doing?’
Say to them, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “This (Mal. 1:1) burden concerns the prince in Jerusalem and all the house of Israel who are among them.” ’
Say, (Ezek. 12:6) ‘I am a sign to you. As I have done, so shall it be done to them; (2 Kin. 25:4, 5, 7) they shall be carried away into captivity.’

And (2 Kin. 25:4; Jer. 39:4; 52:7; Ezek. 12:6) the prince who is among them shall bear his belongings on his shoulder at twilight and go out. They shall dig through the wall to carry them out through it. He shall cover his face, so that he cannot see the ground with his eyes.

I will also spread My (Job 19:6; Jer. 52:9; Lam. 1:13; Ezek. 17:20) net over him, and he shall be caught in My snare. (2 Kin. 25:7; Jer. 52:11; Ezek. 17:16) I will bring him to Babylon, to the land of the Chaldeans; yet he shall not see it, though he shall die there.
(2 Kin. 25:4; Ezek. 5:10) I will scatter to every wind all who are around him to help him, and all his troops; and (Ezek. 5:2, 12) I will draw out the sword after them.
((Ps. 9:16); Ezek. 6:7, 14; 12:16, 20) “Then they shall know that I am the LORD, when I scatter them among the nations and disperse them throughout the countries.

(2 Kin. 25:11, 22; Ezek. 6:8-10) But I will spare a few of their men from the sword, from famine, and from pestilence, that they may declare all their abominations among the Gentiles wherever they go. Then they shall know that I am the LORD.”
Judgment Not Postponed Moreover the word of the LORD came to me, saying,
“Son of man, (Lam. 5:9; Ezek. 4:16) eat your bread with quaking, and drink your water with trembling and anxiety.

And say to the people of the land, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the land of Israel: “They shall eat their bread with anxiety, and drink their water with dread, so that her land may (Jer. 10:22; Ezek. 6:6, 7, 14; Mic. 7:13; Zech. 7:14) be emptied of all who are in it, (Ps. 107:34) because of the violence of all those who dwell in it.
